verdict.summary: Nom's streaming parsers return Incomplete when they need more input. Use complete parsers or provide all input at once.

dead_ends.action: Pad input with extra bytes to satisfy the size requirement
dead_ends.why_fails: Extra bytes corrupt the parse result; the parser needs valid data, not padding

workarounds.action: Use nom::complete combinators instead of nom::streaming
Buffer all input before parsing when using streaming mode
workarounds.how:
let full_input = std::io::read_to_string(reader)?;
let result = parser(&full_input);

leads_to.condition: When nom failures lead to regex-based parsing attempts

preceded_by.condition: When incomplete I/O causes incomplete parser input

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Regex compile error is about pattern validity; nom Incomplete is about insufficient input data for a parser
